data.title: The Ballad of Buster Scruggs (2018)
data.summary: An anthology western following six different storylines centering on a man named Buster Scruggs.

data.title: The Sisters Brothers (2018)
data.summary: In 1850s Oregon, a gold prospector is chased by the infamous duo of assassins, the Sisters brothers.

data.title: Hostiles (2017)
data.summary: In 1892, a legendary Army Captain reluctantly agrees to escort a Cheyenne chief and his family through dangerous territory.

data.title: The Hateful Eight (2015)
data.summary: In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.

data.title: Django Unchained (2012)
data.summary: With the help of a German bounty hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal Mississippi plantation owner.

data.title: The Revenant (2015)
data.summary: A frontiersman on a fur trading expedition in the 1820s fights for survival after being mauled by a bear and left for dead by members of his own hunting team.

data.title: Unforgiven (1992)
data.summary: Retired Old West gunslinger William Munny reluctantly takes on one last job, with the help of his old partner and a young man.

data.title: The Magnificent Seven (2016)
data.summary: Seven gunmen in the old west gradually come together to help a poor village against savage thieves.

data.title: Bone Tomahawk (2015)
data.summary: In the dying days of the old west, an elderly sheriff and his posse set out to rescue their town's doctor from cannibalistic cave dwellers.

data.title: Woman Walks Ahead (2017)
data.summary: Catherine Weldon, a portrait painter from 1890s Brooklyn, travels to Dakota to paint a portrait of Sitting Bull and becomes embroiled in the Lakota peoples' struggle over the rights to their land.

data.title: Il buono, il brutto, il cattivo (1966)
data.summary: A bounty hunting scam joins two men in an uneasy alliance against a third in a race to find a fortune in gold buried in a remote cemetery.

data.title: The Dark Tower (2017)
data.summary: The last Gunslinger: Roland Deschain, has been locked in an eternal battle with Walter O'Dim, also known as the Man in Black, and determined to prevent him from toppling the Dark Tower that holds the universe together. With the fate of the world at stake, good and evil will collide in the ultimate battle, as only Roland can defend the Tower from the Man in Black.

data.title: The Ridiculous 6 (2015)
data.summary: An outlaw who was raised by Native Americans discovers that he has five half-brothers; together the men go on a mission to find their wayward, deadbeat dad.

data.title: Hell or High Water (II) (2016)
data.summary: A divorced father and his ex-con older brother resort to a desperate scheme in order to save their family's ranch in West Texas.

data.title: Damsel (I) (2018)
data.summary: It's the Wild West, circa 1870. Samuel Alabaster, an affluent pioneer, ventures across the American frontier to marry the love of his life, Penelope. As his group traverses the west, the once-simple journey grows treacherous, blurring the lines between hero, villain and damsel.

data.title: Tombstone (1993)
data.summary: A successful lawman's plans to retire anonymously in Tombstone, Arizona, are disrupted by the kind of outlaws he was famous for eliminating.

data.title: True Grit (2010)
data.summary: A stubborn teenager enlists the help of a tough U.S. Marshal to track down her father's murderer.

data.title: The Ballad of Lefty Brown (2017)
data.summary: A thrilling and action-packed Western, The Ballad of Lefty Brown is a story about loyalty, friendship, and the relentless pursuit of justice.

data.title: The Quick and the Dead (1995)
data.summary: A female gunfighter returns to a frontier town where a dueling tournament is being held, which she enters in an effort to avenge her father's death.

data.title: The Rider (2017)
data.summary: After suffering a near fatal head injury, a young cowboy undertakes a search for new identity and what it means to be a man in the heartland of America.

data.title: Once Upon a Time in the West (1968)
data.summary: A mysterious stranger with a harmonica joins forces with a notorious desperado to protect a beautiful widow from a ruthless assassin working for the railroad.

data.title: Brimstone (2016)
data.summary: From the moment the new reverend climbs the pulpit, Liz knows she and her family are in great danger.

data.title: The Magnificent Seven (1960)
data.summary: An oppressed Mexican peasant village hires seven gunfighters to help defend their homes.

data.title: A Million Ways to Die in the West (2014)
data.summary: As a cowardly farmer begins to fall for the mysterious new woman in town, he must put his new-found courage to the test when her husband, a notorious gun-slinger, announces his arrival.

data.title: Young Guns (1988)
data.summary: A group of young gunmen, led by Billy the Kid, become deputies to avenge the murder of the rancher who became their benefactor. But when Billy takes their authority too far, they become the hunted.

data.title: Dances with Wolves (1990)
data.summary: Lieutenant John Dunbar, assigned to a remote western Civil War outpost, befriends wolves and Indians, making him an intolerable aberration in the military.

data.title: Rio Bravo (1959)
data.summary: A small-town sheriff in the American West enlists the help of a cripple, a drunk, and a young gunfighter in his efforts to hold in jail the brother of the local bad guy.

data.title: Legends of the Fall (1994)
data.summary: In the early 1900s, three brothers and their father living in the remote wilderness of Montana are affected by betrayal, history, love, nature, and war.

data.title: Blazing Saddles (1974)
data.summary: In order to ruin a western town, a corrupt politician appoints a black Sheriff, who promptly becomes his most formidable adversary.

data.title: Silverado (1985)
data.summary: A misfit bunch of friends come together to right the injustices which exist in a small town.

data.title: 3:10 to Yuma (2007)
data.summary: A small-time rancher agrees to hold a captured outlaw who's awaiting a train to go to court in Yuma. A battle of wills ensues as the outlaw tries to psych out the rancher.

data.title: The Searchers (1956)
data.summary: An American Civil War veteran embarks on a journey to rescue his niece from the Comanches.

data.title: The Kid (I)
data.summary: The story of a young boy who witnesses Billy the Kid's encounter with Sheriff Pat Garrett.

data.title: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid (1969)
data.summary: Wyoming, early 1900s. Butch Cassidy and The Sundance Kid are the leaders of a band of outlaws. After a train robbery goes wrong they find themselves on the run with a posse hard on their heals. Their solution - escape to Bolivia.

data.title: Cowboys & Aliens (2011)
data.summary: A spaceship arrives in Arizona, 1873, to take over the Earth, starting with the Wild West region. A posse of cowboys and natives are all that stand in their way.

data.title: How the West Was Won (1962)
data.summary: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the nineteenth century - including the Gold Rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads.

data.title: ¡Three Amigos! (1986)
data.summary: Three actors accept an invitation to a Mexican village to perform their onscreen bandit fighter roles, unaware that it is the real thing.

data.title: Back to the Future Part III (1990)
data.summary: Enjoying a peaceable existence in 1885, Doctor Emmet Brown is about to be killed by Buford "Mad Dog" Tannen. Marty McFly travels back in time to save his friend.

data.title: The Lone Ranger (2013)
data.summary: Native American warrior Tonto recounts the untold tales that transformed John Reid, a man of the law, into a legend of justice.

data.title: 100 Rifles (1969)
data.summary: In 1912 Sonora, Mexico, native revolutionary Yaqui Joe robs a bank to buy arms for his oppressed people, but finds himself sought by an American lawman and the Mexican Army.

data.title: Per un pugno di dollari (1964)
data.summary: A wandering gunfighter plays two rival families against each other in a town torn apart by greed, pride, and revenge.

data.title: True Grit (1969)
data.summary: A drunken, hard-nosed U.S. Marshal and a Texas Ranger help a stubborn teenager track down her father's murderer in Indian territory.

data.title: Abraham Lincoln: Vampire Hunter (2012)
data.summary: Abraham Lincoln, the 16th President of the United States, discovers vampires are planning to take over the United States. He makes it his mission to eliminate them.

data.title: Sweet Country (2017)
data.summary: Australian western set on the Northern Territory frontier in the 1920s, where justice itself is put on trial when an aged Aboriginal farmhand shoots a white man in self-defense and goes on the run as a posse gathers to hunt him down.

data.title: Per qualche dollaro in più (1965)
data.summary: Two bounty hunters with the same intentions team up to track down a Western outlaw.

data.title: Jonah Hex (2010)
data.summary: The U.S. military makes a scarred bounty hunter with warrants on his own head an offer he cannot refuse: in exchange for his freedom, he must stop a terrorist who is ready to unleash Hell on Earth.

data.title: Westworld (1973)
data.summary: A robot malfunction creates havoc and terror for unsuspecting vacationers at a futuristic, adult-themed amusement park.

data.title: Wyatt Earp (1994)
data.summary: The story of Wyatt Earp as he interacts and battles other famous figures of the Wild West era.

data.title: Wild Wild West (1999)
data.summary: The two best hired guns in the West must save President Grant from the clutches of a nineteenth-century inventor-villain.

data.title: The Mask of Zorro (1998)
data.summary: A young thief, seeking revenge for the death of his brother, is trained by the once great, but aged Zorro, who also pursues vengeance of his own.

data.title: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford (2007)
data.summary: Robert Ford, who's idolized Jesse James since childhood, tries hard to join the reforming gang of the Missouri outlaw, but gradually becomes resentful of the bandit leader.

data.title: The Wind (II) (2018)
data.summary: A supernatural thriller set in the Western frontier of the late 1800s, The Wind stars Caitlin Gerard (INSIDIOUS: THE LAST KEY) as a plains-woman driven mad by the harshness and isolation of...                See full summary »

data.title: Maverick (1994)
data.summary: Bret Maverick, needing money for a poker tournament, faces various comic mishaps and challenges, including a charming woman thief.

data.title: Cowboy (1958)
data.summary: An idealistic tenderfoot Chicago hotel clerk is taken on a cattle-drive to Mexico by famous trail boss Tom Reece but discovers that cowboy life isn't what he expected.

data.title: Slow West (2015)
data.summary: A young Scottish man travels across America in pursuit of the woman he loves, attracting the attention of an outlaw who is willing to serve as a guide.

data.title: Any Bullet Will Do (2018)
data.summary: Taking place during 1876 in Montana, a ruthless headhunter tracks his own Brother through Big Sky country with the help of a young fur trapper.

data.title: Navajo Joe (1966)
data.summary: A Native American warrior called Navajo Joe seeks revenge on a gang of sadistic outlaws who has massacred the people of his tribe.

data.title: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance (1962)
data.summary: A senator, who became famous for killing a notorious outlaw, returns for the funeral of an old friend and tells the truth about his deed.

data.title: Chisum (1970)
data.summary: Cattle baron John Chisum joins forces with Billy the Kid and Pat Garrett to fight the Lincoln County land war.

data.title: Heaven's Gate (1980)
data.summary: A dramatization of the real-life Johnson County War in 1890 Wyoming, in which a Sheriff born into wealth, attempts to protect immigrant farmers from rich cattle interests.

data.title: The Wild Bunch (1969)
data.summary: An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the "traditional" American West is disappearing around them.

data.title: Giant (1956)
data.summary: Sprawling epic covering the life of a Texas cattle rancher and his family and associates.

data.title: The Legend of Zorro (2005)
data.summary: Despite trying to keep his swashbuckling to a minimum, a threat to California's pending statehood causes the adventure-loving Alejandro de la Vega (Banderas) -- and his wife, Elena (Zeta-Jones) -- to take action.

data.title: I'm Not There. (2007)
data.summary: Ruminations on the life of Bob Dylan, where six characters embody a different aspect of the musician's life and work.

data.title: Far and Away (1992)
data.summary: A young Irish couple flee to the States, but subsequently struggle to obtain land and prosper freely.

data.title: The Outlaw Josey Wales (1976)
data.summary: A Missouri farmer joins a Confederate guerrilla unit and winds up on the run from the Union soldiers who murdered his family.

data.title: In a Valley of Violence (2016)
data.summary: A mysterious stranger and a random act of violence drag a town of misfits and nitwits into the bloody crosshairs of revenge.

data.title: Urban Cowboy (1980)
data.summary: Bud is a young man from the country who learns about life and love in a Houston bar.

data.title: The Homesman (2014)
data.summary: Three women who have been driven mad by pioneer life are to be transported across the country by covered wagon by the pious, independent-minded Mary Bee Cuddy, who in turn employs low-life drifter George Briggs to assist her.

data.title: Young Guns II (1990)
data.summary: In 1881, cattle baron John Chisum pays a bounty to Patrick Floyd Garrett to kill outlaw Billy the Kid.

data.title: A Reckoning (2018)
data.summary: After a her husband is brutally murdered, a widowed homesteader seeks revenge and leaves everything behind to hunt down his killer.

data.title: Open Range (2003)
data.summary: A former gunslinger is forced to take up arms again when he and his cattle crew are threatened by a corrupt lawman.

data.title: El Topo (1970)
data.summary: A mysterious black-clad gunfighter wanders a mystical Western landscape encountering multiple bizarre characters.

data.title: Bubba Ho-Tep (2002)
data.summary: Based on the Bram Stoker Award nominee short story by cult author Joe R. Lansdale, Bubba Ho-tep tells the "true" story of what really did become of Elvis Presley. We find Elvis (Bruce ...                See full summary »

data.title: Dead Man (1995)
data.summary: On the run after murdering a man, accountant William Blake encounters a strange North American man named Nobody who prepares him for his journey into the spiritual world.

data.title: Oklahoma! (1955)
data.summary: In Oklahoma, several farmers, cowboys and a traveling salesman compete for the romantic favors of various local ladies.

data.title: Quigley Down Under (1990)
data.summary: Sharpshooter Matt Quigley is hired from Wyoming by an Australian rancher paying a very high price. But when Quigley arrives Down Under, all is not as it seems.

data.title: Support Your Local Sheriff! (1969)
data.summary: In the old west, a man becomes a Sheriff just for the pay, figuring he can decamp if things get tough. In the end, he uses ingenuity instead.

data.title: The Man Who Loved Cat Dancing (1973)
data.summary: Western story about a defiant wife who leaves her husband to take up riding with outlaws.

data.title: Stagecoach (1939)
data.summary: A group of people traveling on a stagecoach find their journey complicated by the threat of Geronimo and learn something about each other in the process.

data.title: Valley of the Sun (1942)
data.summary: In 1868, Army scout Johnny Ware is courtmartialed for helping Indians against their white oppressors, but escapes and finds himself in the hamlet of Desert Center. There, he crosses paths ...                See full summary »

data.title: High Noon (1952)
data.summary: A town Marshal, despite the disagreements of his newlywed bride and the townspeople around him, must face a gang of deadly killers alone at high noon when the gang leader, an outlaw he sent up years ago, arrives on the noon train.

data.title: Shane (1953)
data.summary: A weary gunfighter attempts to settle down with a homestead family, but a smoldering settler/rancher conflict forces him to act.

data.title: The True History of the Kelly Gang
data.summary: Based on Peter Carey's novel. The story of Australian bush-ranger Ned Kelly and his gang as they flee from authorities during the 1870s.

data.title: The Horse Whisperer (1998)
data.summary: The mother of a severely traumatized daughter enlists the aid of a unique horse trainer to help the girl's equally injured horse.

data.title: Pale Rider (1985)
data.summary: A mysterious preacher protects a humble prospector village from a greedy mining company trying to encroach on their land.

data.title: Jeremiah Johnson (1972)
data.summary: A mountain man who wishes to live the life of a hermit becomes the unwilling object of a long vendetta by Indians, and proves to be a match for their warriors in one-on-one combat on the early frontier.

data.title: The Salvation (2014)
data.summary: In 1870s America, the fury of a notorious gang leader is unleashed when a peaceful American settler avenges the death of his family. Then as his cowardly fellow townspeople betray him, he is forced to hunt down the outlaws alone.

data.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers (1954)
data.summary: In 1850 Oregon, when a backwoodsman brings a wife home to his farm, his six brothers decide that they want to get married too.

data.title: Shanghai Noon (2000)
data.summary: A Chinese man travels to the Wild West to rescue a kidnapped Princess. After teaming up with a train robber, the unlikely duo takes on a Chinese traitor and his corrupt boss.

data.title: El Dorado (1967)
data.summary: Cole Thornton, a gunfighter for hire, joins forces with an old friend, Sheriff J.P. Hara. Together with an old Indian fighter and a gambler, they help a rancher and his family fight a rival rancher that is trying to steal their water.

data.title: The Wild and the Innocent (1959)
data.summary: In Wyoming, mountain trapper Yancy goes to the nearest town to trade his pelts but gets into trouble when he tries to save runaway saloon girl Rosalie from her shameful job.

data.title: The Long Riders (1980)
data.summary: The origins, exploits and the ultimate fate of the Jesse James gang is told in a sympathetic portrayal of the bank robbers made up of brothers who begin their legendary bank raids because of revenge.

data.title: Sam Whiskey (1969)
data.summary: Sam Whiskey is an all-round talent, but when the attractive widow Laura offers him a job, he hesitates: he shall salvage gold bars, which Laura's dead husband stole recently, from a sunken ...                See full summary »

data.title: The Proposition (2005)
data.summary: A lawman apprehends a notorious outlaw and gives him nine days to kill his older brother, or else they'll execute his younger brother.

data.title: High Plains Drifter (1973)
data.summary: A gunfighting stranger comes to the small settlement of Lago and is hired to bring the townsfolk together in an attempt to hold off three outlaws who are on their way.

data.title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre (1948)
data.summary: Fred Dobbs and Bob Curtin, two Americans searching for work in Mexico, convince an old prospector to help them mine for gold in the Sierra Madre Mountains.

data.title: Hidalgo (2004)
data.summary: In 1890, a down-and-out cowboy and his horse travel to Arabia to compete in a deadly cross desert horse race.
